categories.title: extensions
categories.description: Useful tools that utilize the Posit Connect API to extend the functionality of Connect.

categories.title: examples
categories.description: Pre-built content to illustrate the types of content publishable on Posit Connect.

extensions.name: chat-with-content
extensions.title: Chat with Content
extensions.description: Provides a way to interact with and query content using an LLM chat interface.

extensions.name: connectwidgets-example
extensions.title: Connect Widgets Example
extensions.description: connectwidgets is an R package that can be used to query for a subset of your existing content items, then organize them within htmlwidget components in an R Markdown document or Shiny application.

extensions.name: content-health-monitor
extensions.title: Content Health Monitor
extensions.description: This report uses the publisherâ€™s API key to monitor a single piece of content. It checks whether the content is reachable, but does not validate its functionality. When scheduled to run regularly, it will send an email alert if the content becomes unreachable.

extensions.name: fastapitableau-example
extensions.title: Tableau Python Extension
extensions.description: fastapitableau is a Python package that enables Python developers to build FastAPI APIs that function as Tableau Analytics Extensions. These extensions can be leveraged from Tableau workbooks to allow real time requests from Tableau to Python. This extension builds on top of Tableau's example Superstore dataset.

extensions.name: landing-page
extensions.title: Static HTML landing page
extensions.description: A simple static HTML web page that can be served from Connect

extensions.name: package-vulnerability-scanner
extensions.title: Package Vulnerability Scanner
extensions.description: Scan for security vulnerabilities in your published content on Connect using Posit Package Manager. View an overview of CVEs (Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures) across all your apps, and get guidance on upgrading affected packages.

extensions.name: plumbertableau-example
extensions.title: plumbertableau example
extensions.description: plumbertableau is an R package that enables R developers to build Plumber APIs that function as Tableau Analytics Extensions. These extensions can be leveraged from Tableau workbooks to allow real time requests from Tableau to R. This extension builds on top of Tableau's example Superstore dataset.

extensions.name: portfolio-dashboard
extensions.title: Portfolio Dashboard
extensions.description: A shiny application makes it easy to transform your analysis into an interactive dashboard using R so users can ask and answer questions in real-time, without having to touch any code.

extensions.name: portfolio-report
extensions.title: Portfolio Report
extensions.description: This R Markdown document includes parameters, making it easier for stakeholders to customize the report's assumptions and create their own version. The main document serves as a standard base template, containing your core code and analysis, so you don't have to copy, paste, and republish.

extensions.name: pqr
extensions.title: Quarto Document with Python and R
extensions.description: A Quarto document that executes Python and R code.

extensions.name: publisher-command-center
extensions.title: Publisher Command Center
extensions.description: An app that helps publishers view and manage details about apps and dashboards deployed to Connect. View app metadata and history for all of the apps you are collaborating on as well as see and managing running process for individual apps.

extensions.name: quarto-document
extensions.title: Quarto Document
extensions.description: This Quarto example shows how a basic document can present diagrams and interactivity.

extensions.name: quarto-presentation
extensions.title: Quarto Presentation
extensions.description: This presentation is generated using Quarto and reveal.js. It demonstrates how you might use code to highlight your work.

extensions.name: quarto-stock-report-python
extensions.title: Quarto Stock Report using Python
extensions.description: An example of how you might automate regular updates using a data source

extensions.name: quarto-stock-report-r
extensions.title: Quarto Stock Report using R
extensions.description: This stock report is generated using Quarto and R. It is an example of how you might automate regular updates using a data source. The report also generates a custom email, sharing the results directly to stakeholders.

extensions.name: quarto-website
extensions.title: Quarto Website
extensions.description: This Quarto website uses the Posit Connect Server API together with Python to construct a dashboard that presents published content. Views showing featured and all content are included. Set the `FEATURED_TAGS` environment variable and feature content having a particular tag name.

extensions.name: runtime-version-scanner
extensions.title: Runtime Version Scanner
extensions.description: See the Python, R, and Quarto versions used by your content. Filter by version, content type, and usage to identify items that need updating. Quickly find content that uses end-of-life language versions.

extensions.name: script-python
extensions.title: Run a Python Script
extensions.description: This data transformation Python script is an example of how you might automate regular imports and transformations from a data source. JSON and CSV files are exported and made available for download. Quarto is used to render the script.

extensions.name: script-r
extensions.title: Run an R Script
extensions.description: This data transformation R script is an example of how you might automate regular imports and transformations from a data source. JSON and CSV files are exported and made available for download. Quarto is used to render the script. The script also generates a custom email, with the generated CSV files as attachments.

extensions.name: simple-mcp-server
extensions.title: Simple MCP Server
extensions.description: A simple example of a Connect extension that serves tools via the MCP protocol. This is meant to be used with the Simple Shiny Chat with MCP Support extension.

extensions.name: simple-shiny-chat-with-mcp
extensions.title: Simple Shiny Chat with MCP Support
extensions.description: A simple Shiny chat application that demonstrates how to use the MCP client to facilitate remote tool calls. This is meant to be used with the Simple MCP Server extension.

extensions.name: stock-api-fastapi
extensions.title: FastAPI Stock Pricing Service
extensions.description: APIs are a great way for software engineering teams to use your models without translating them into different languages

extensions.name: stock-api-flask
extensions.title: Flask Stock Pricing Service
extensions.description: APIs are a great way for software engineering teams to use your models without translating them into different languages

extensions.name: stock-api-plumber
extensions.title: Stock Pricing Service with Plumber API
extensions.description: An API allows you to turn your models into production services that other tools and teams can use. APIs are a great way for software engineering teams to use your models without translating them into different languages.

extensions.name: stock-dashboard-python
extensions.title: Stock Pricing Dashboard using Python Dash
extensions.description: A Dash application makes it easy to transform your analysis into an interactive dashboard using Python so users can ask and answer questions in real-time, without having to touch any code.

extensions.name: stock-report
extensions.title: Automated Stock Report
extensions.description: This R Markdown document shows how to automate regular updates to a PDF. The report code also generates a custom email, re-using the plots and putting the results where stakeholders live - their inbox.

extensions.name: stock-report-jupyter
extensions.title: Stock Report using Jupyter
extensions.description: This stock report is generated using Python and Jupyter Notebook. Stock prices are populated from Quandl to generate a stock performance summary intended to run daily after market close.

extensions.name: top-5-income-share-bokeh
extensions.title: Top 5% income share using Bokeh
extensions.description: A Bokeh application makes it easy to transform your analysis into an interactive dashboard using Python so users can ask and answer questions in real-time, without having to touch any code.

extensions.name: top-5-income-share-shiny
extensions.title: Top 5% income share using Shiny
extensions.description: A Shiny application makes it easy to transform your analysis into an interactive application using Python so users can ask and answer their own questions in real-time.

extensions.name: top-5-income-share-streamlit
extensions.title: Top 5% income share using Streamlit
extensions.description: A Streamlit application makes it easy to transform your analysis into an interactive dashboard using Python so users can ask and answer questions in real-time, without having to touch any code.

extensions.name: usage-metrics-dashboard
extensions.title: Usage Metrics Dashboard
extensions.description: Understand usage patterns across your work on Connect. Browse an overview of usage across everything you've published, and dive into detailed breakdowns of data for an individual deployment, down to the level of individual visits.

extensions.name: voila-example
extensions.title: Secure Hashes with VoilÃ
extensions.description: VoilÃ  allows you to convert a Jupyter Notebook into an interactive dashboard that allows you to share your work with others.
